availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, soldier. Scott County, Kentucky, native. Son of Joseph Fenwyck and Sarah Fenwyck. Married to Malissa Fenwyck. Resident of Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Bath County in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 9, 1862, to September 17, 1863. Farmhand in Marshall County, Kansas, in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 63B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 162.
Kansas State Census (1865), Population Schedules, Marshall County, Vermillion Township.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0101.
"William Fenwyck (1840-1910)," Find A Grave, Memorial 99555289, accessed February 17, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99555289.
